list.title: AudioTrack
list.description: Represents audio track information associated with a media resource.

list.title: ComposedSrcMediaData
list.description: Represents the result of composing source media data.

list.title: DrmMetadata
list.description: Represents Digital Rights Management (DRM) information associated with a media resource.

list.title: HbbtvProperties
list.description: Represents HbbTV properties associated with a chapter.

list.title: KeySystems
list.description: Represents the result of building key systems.

list.title: KeySystems#keySystems
list.description: A mapping of DRM types to their corresponding key systems information. For "FAIRPLAY" type, it includes a structure with certificate and license URIs; for other types, it's a string representing the license URL.

list.title: MainResource
list.description: Represents the transformed format of a resource.

list.title: MainResource#drmList
list.description: List of DRM information from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#imageCopyright
list.description: The url of the copyright image copyright from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#imageUrl
list.description: The url of the image from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResourceWithKeySystems
list.description: A {@link MainResource} that can contain {@link KeySystems} information.

list.title: MediaComposition#findMainSegment
list.description: Return a segment from main chapter following segmentUrn in mediaComposition.

list.title: MediaComposition#getFilteredExternalSubtitles
list.description:
Filter external text tracks that are already available internally.

Rules:

  1. TTML format is filtered

  2. If both are empty that means only internal text tracks will be displayed to the user as they are automatically loaded by the player.

  3. If subtitleInformationList is missing from the MediaComposition and subtitleList is available but the media contains internal text tracks that are also available internally. It will result on a duplication client side.

  4. If subtitleList and subtitleInformationList a merge between both will be operated, removing the external text tracks already available internally.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainBlockReason
list.description: Block reason for main chapter. This also uses current date for STARTDATE.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainBlockedSegments
list.description: Get blocked segments from the main chapter.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainChapterImageUrl
list.description: Get the main chapter's image URL decorated with default width and format.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainSegments
list.description: Get segments of the main chapter ordered by markIn.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainTimeIntervals
list.description: Retrieves an array of time intervals associated with the main chapter.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainValidFromDate
list.description: Compute a date from which this content is valid. Always return a date object.

list.title: Player#audioTrack
list.description: A getter/setter for the media's audio track. Activates the audio track according to the language and kind properties. Falls back on the first audio track found if the kind property is not satisfied.

list.title: Player#bufferedRanges
list.description: Calculates an array of ranges based on the buffered() data.

list.title: Player#playedPercent
list.description:
Get the percent (as a decimal) of the media that's been played. This method is not a part of the native HTML video API.

Live streams with DVR are not currently supported.

list.title: Player#playedRanges
list.description: Get an array of ranges based on the played data.

list.title: Player#seekableRanges
list.description: Calculates an array of ranges based on the seekable() data.

list.title: Player#textTrack
list.description: A getter/setter for the media's text track. Activates the text track according to the language and kind properties. Falls back on the first text track found if the kind property is not satisfied. Disables all subtitle tracks that are showing if the trackSelector is truthy but does not satisfy any condition.

list.title: PlayerProperty
list.description: Represents a player property associated with a media segment.

list.title: RelatedContent
list.description: Represents related content associated with a media segment.

list.title: Resource
list.description: Represents a resource associated with a media segment.

list.title: Segment
list.description: Represents a media segment with detailed metadata.

list.title: SocialCountEntry
list.description: Represents a social media count entry associated with a media segment.

list.title: SpriteSheet
list.description: Represents a sprite sheet associated with a chapter.

list.title: SrgOptions
list.description:
Represents a set of options specific to the SRG SSR.

Note:

  • All these options have a default value and can therefore be undefined.
  • DataProvider options cannot be combined with each other.

list.title: SrgSsr.addRemoteTextTracks
list.description: Adds remote text tracks from an array of subtitles.

list.title: SrgSsr.addTextTrackCue
list.description: Add a new cue to a text track with the given data.

list.title: SrgSsr.addTextTracks
list.description: Add multiple text tracks to the player.

list.title: SrgSsr.blockingReason
list.description: Set a blocking reason according to the block reason returned by mediaData.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeAkamaiResources
list.description: Add the Akamai token to all resources if at least one of them has tokenType set to Akamai.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeKeySystemsResources
list.description: Add the keySystems property to all resources if at least one of them has DRM.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeMainResources
list.description: Get the main resources from a mediaComposition. May add an Akamai token or key systems if required by the resource.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeSrcMediaData
list.description: Compose source options with media data. MediaData properties from source options overwrite mediaData from IL.

list.title: SrgSsr.cuechangeEventProxy
list.description: Proxy SRG SSR chapters and intervals cuechange events at player level.

list.title: SrgSsr.dataProviderError
list.description: Set an error if something goes wrong with the data provider.

list.title: SrgSsr.filterIncompatibleResources
list.description: Filter out incompatible resources such as RTMP and HDS.

list.title: SrgSsr.getBlockedSegment
list.description: Get the current blocked segment from the player.

list.title: SrgSsr.getBlockedSegmentByTime
list.description: Get the VTT cue of a blocked segment.

list.title: SrgSsr.getMediaData
list.description: Get the mediaData most likely to be compatible depending on the browser.

list.title: SrgSsr.handleCurrentTime
list.description:
Handles the middleware's currentTime function.

  • If the current time is between the start and end of a blocked segment, the blocked portion will be skipped.

Note: This function should disappear as soon as this behavior is supported on the packaging side.

list.title: SrgSsr.handleSetCurrentTime
list.description:
Handles the middleware's setCurrentTime function.

  • Modify the current time if the value is between the start and end of a blocked segment.

Note: This function should disappear as soon as this behavior is supported on the packaging side.

list.title: SrgSsr.handleSetSource
list.description:
Handles the middleware's setSource function.

This function allows to:

  • resolve a URN into media that can be played by the player
  • initialize media playback tracking
  • update the title bar
  • handle blocking reasons
  • add remote subtitles

list.title: SrgSsr.middleware
list.description: Middleware to resolve SRG SSR URNs into playable media.

list.title: SrgSsr.updateTitleBar
list.description: Update player titleBar with title and description.

list.title: Subtitle
list.description: Represents subtitle information for a media segment.

list.title: SubtitleInformation
list.description: Represents subtitle information associated with a media resource.

list.title: TimeInterval
list.description: Represents a time interval metadata used to mark the beginning and ending of opening or closing credits.

list.title: pillarbox
list.description: Pillarbox is an alias for the video.js namespace with additional options.

list.title: pillarbox.options.fill
list.description: Enable fill mode for the video player, allowing it to expand to fill the container.

list.title: pillarbox.options.html5
list.description: Configuration options for HTML5 settings in Pillarbox.

list.title: pillarbox.options.liveui
list.description:
Allows the player to use the live ui that includes:

  • A progress bar for seeking within the live window
  • A button that can be clicked to seek to the live edge with a circle indicating if you are at the live edge or not.

list.title: pillarbox.options.playsinline
list.description: Indicates that the video is to be played "inline", that is within the element's playback area.

list.title: pillarbox.options.responsive
list.description: Enable responsive mode, this will cause the player to customize itself based on responsive breakpoints.

list.title: pillarbox.options.trackers
list.description: A placeholder for accessing trackers directly from the player.
